solution_line_template: First, we need to determine how many feet Ian runs in a week. We begin this by multiplying the number of laps by the number of feet per lap, performing {laps_per_night}*{feet_per_lap}= <<{laps_per_night}*{feet_per_lap}={feet_per_day}>>{feet_per_day} feet per day.
Since there are {number_of_days} days in the period being measured, this means Ian runs {feet_per_day}*{number_of_days}= <<{total_feet_jogged}={total_feet_jogged}>>{total_feet_jogged} feet jogged.

Since it takes {feet_per_calorie} feet of jogging to burn a calorie, this means Ian burns {total_feet_jogged}/{feet_per_calorie}=<<{total_feet_jogged}/{feet_per_calorie}={total_calories_burned}>>{total_calories_burned} calories burned jogging throughout the week.
